raw_data.title: OCONUS - Technical Project Management Support
raw_data.description: The contractor shall provide on-site support. The contractor shall monitor Heating Ventilation and Air Conditioning control equipment and to correct equipment operations based on control parameters. Typical duties include: Assists Hospital Engineer in determining the condition of Direct Digital Controls supporting Medical Center HVAC equipment. Recommends to Hospital Engineer parameters to correct DDC controls on HVAC equipment such as air handler units, exhaust fans, and refrigeration systems. Makes DDC changes to correct air flow, temperature, pressure, or other interior environmental conditions. Assists in monitoring DDC alarms, assists Hospital Engineer in determining the condition HVAC equipment conditions which initiate these alarms, adjusts DDC controls as necessary, and coordinates corrections of mechanical deficiencies with maintenance technicians. Assists in researching air flow rates and air pressure differentials in negative pressure and positive pressure patient care rooms. Assists in evaluating deficiencies and works with health care professionals such as Infection Control, Industrial Hygiene, Mechanical Engineers, and Nursing to correct these deficiencies. Implements corrections based on Unified Facilities Criteria and Facilities Guidelines Institute accepted standards. (Examples of areas serviced are Urology, Intensive Care Unit, Urology, & Bio Safety Lab) Makes recommendations to an electrical engineer or engineering technician regarding revisions to the building automation hardware and associated building automation system functions. Assist medical facility personnel in the preparation of necessary project requirements and coordination when needed for addition and modifications of building automation systems. Assists the electrical engineers or engineering technicians to design and implement various building automation hardware and computer software systems. Assists in implementing energy conservation measures by utilizing and/or modifying the existing building automation system features. Assists in performing necessary commissioning, diagnostic, and maintenance procedures such as field verification of system failures to insure the proper operation of building automation systems. Assists in monitoring building automation system equipment and alerts HVAC technicians and operations engineers of HVAC problems. Support in the review of building construction designs, and systems. Joint Commission Related Inspections: Monitor maintenance, inspections, testing, and reporting of hospital safety systems. Survey & Inspection: Routinely inspect facilities to determine facility conditions as it relates to safety compliance. Participate in weekly medical center wide environmental maintenance rounds. Planning: Support with the development of plans and prepares project specifications and cost estimates. raw_data.title: OCONUS - Technical Project Management Support
raw_data.description: The contractor shall provide on-site support. The contractor shall monitor Heating Ventilation and Air Conditioning control equipment and to correct equipment operations based on control parameters. Typical duties include: Assists Hospital Engineer in determining the condition of Direct Digital Controls supporting Medical Center HVAC equipment. Recommends to Hospital Engineer parameters to correct DDC controls on HVAC equipment such as air handler units, exhaust fans, and refrigeration systems. Makes DDC changes to correct air flow, temperature, pressure, or other interior environmental conditions. Assists in monitoring DDC alarms, assists Hospital Engineer in determining the condition HVAC equipment conditions which initiate these alarms, adjusts DDC controls as necessary, and coordinates corrections of mechanical deficiencies with maintenance technicians. Assists in researching air flow rates and air pressure differentials in negative pressure and positive pressure patient care rooms. Assists in evaluating deficiencies and works with health care professionals such as Infection Control, Industrial Hygiene, Mechanical Engineers, and Nursing to correct these deficiencies. Implements corrections based on Unified Facilities Criteria and Facilities Guidelines Institute accepted standards. (Examples of areas serviced are Urology, Intensive Care Unit, Urology, & Bio Safety Lab) Makes recommendations to an electrical engineer or engineering technician regarding revisions to the building automation hardware and associated building automation system functions. Assist medical facility personnel in the preparation of necessary project requirements and coordination when needed for addition and modifications of building automation systems. Assists the electrical engineers or engineering technicians to design and implement various building automation hardware and computer software systems. Assists in implementing energy conservation measures by utilizing and/or modifying the existing building automation system features. Assists in performing necessary commissioning, diagnostic, and maintenance procedures such as field verification of system failures to insure the proper operation of building automation systems. Assists in monitoring building automation system equipment and alerts HVAC technicians and operations engineers of HVAC problems. Teams with Zone Managers and HVAC technicians to correct environmental conditions within the Hospital. Assist in editing of computer programs for building automation system to modify alarm specifications. Assists in coordinating computer and associated building automation system hardware service work.

The work includes necessary field investigation to support in determining scopes of work. Drawings & Specifications: The contractor shall be able to produce and read drawings and specifications for new construction or modification of existing architectural systems. The contractor shall read and interpret building plans, wiring diagrams, engineering drawings, specifications, sketches, and maintenance or repair manuals. Project Review: The contractor shall assist in technical reviews. Project Execution: The contractor shall assist in the planning and coordination of various phases of work to accommodate the needs of tenant customers and those occupying spaces surrounding the work. The contractor shall assist in obtaining the necessary clearances for work including approvals for utility outages, digging permits, safety, environmental clearances, sanitation, etc., from proper officials. Quality Verification & Analysis: The contractor shall assist in performing quality verification & analysis duties to support construction, repair, and maintenance contracts. Troubleshooting: The contractor shall assist in investigating, analyzing and resolving problems pertaining to the construction, maintenance, and repair of facilities, architecture systems, equipment, and subsystems. Joint Commission Related Inspections: The contractor shall assist in monitor maintenance, inspections, testing, and reporting of hospital architectural systems. Survey & Inspection: The contractor shall assist in the inspection of facilities to determine the condition of facilities, and develops plans for improvement. Coordinates and executes mechanical, medical gas outages such as HVAC Systems with customers. Shall often be called upon to provide support during the outages. Support in the review engineering designs for flaws or possible improvements.

raw_data.title: CONUS - Medical Document Control Support
raw_data.description: Duties include on-site technical support of Medical Center electrical and mechanical systems such as emergency power systems, electrical distribution system, Heating Ventilation Air Conditioning, plumbing, steam and chilled water. Provide support for the technical solutions to resolve mechanical and electrical issues and provide technical support in estimating costs to correct issues as well as observing and reporting to appropriate government officials’ contractor’s work in correcting issues. Typical duties include: Assist in the coordination of service outages as new systems are connected to current systems; and will be present during the outage. Assist in coordination of utility outages involving electrical systems and document the return of systems to normal performance after installation repair or outage upgrades. Provide assistance in reviewing technical submittals and project submissions. Work with various other onsite personnel in planning and coordinating major shutdowns. Assist in the preparation of all construction project requirements. Assists ensuring that all appropriate Federal, state, local and facility guidelines and principles are followed.
